timeline.bodyText: It should also run on windows. See VM_Sanity.csv
timeline.author: llxia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,25 @@ SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0 OR Apache-2.0 OR GPL-2.0 WITH Classpath-excepti
 		</impls>
 	</test>
 
+	<test>
+		<testCaseName>testDDRExt_Class</testCaseName>
+		<command>ant -DJAVA_COMMAND=$(JAVA_COMMAND) -DTEST_ROOT=${TEST_ROOT} -DTEST_JDK_HOME=${TEST_JDK_HOME} -DJDK_VERSION=${JDK_VERSION} \
+	-DTEST_RESROOT=$(TEST_RESROOT) -DRESOURCES_DIR=${RESOURCES_DIR} -DREPORTDIR=${REPORTDIR} -DOS=${OS} -DBITS=$(BITS) -DLIB_DIR=${LIB_DIR} \
+	-Dtest.list=$(Q)TestClassExt$(Q) -DADDITIONALEXPORTS=$(ADDEXPORTS_JDKASM_UNNAMED) -f $(Q)$(TEST_RESROOT)$(D)tck_ddrext.xml$(Q); \
+	$(TEST_STATUS)</command>
+		<platformRequirements>^os.win</platformRequirements>

replies.bodyText: shall I make another test target only for os.win with level sanity? Or shall I simply delete this platform requirement ^os.win ?
replies.author: OscarQQ

replies.bodyText: We can just remove the platformRequirements as all DDR tests in playlist.xml run in extended.
replies.author: llxia

timeline.bodyText: This should change to "j9vm/test/corehelper/SimpleThread$DumperThread" otherwise the test might actually find SimpleThread instead of SimpleThread.DumperThread and subsequently fail.
timeline.author: keithc-ca
